Package application.utility

Class CSVUtility

java.lang.Object
application.utility.CSVUtility
public class CSVUtility extends Object
This CSVUtility public class is an utility that provides useful static methods for all CSV File management which includes Reading, Writing, Adding, and Sorting File leader-board.csv
Author:
jianchayapol

  • Method Details

    • readCSV

      public static ArrayList<String> readCSV()
      An public static method for reading all data in this the csv file by reading through each line of the file and add to the ArrayList
      Returns:
      an ArrayList containing all text data in format of { "Name,1,0", "Name2,1,0", ... }

    • appendToCSV

      public static void appendToCSV​(String[] toAddText)
      An public static method for appending the player's progress to the CSV file by reading through each line of the file and check conditions of adding to filter some line that does not match the condition out. condition: If the name of toAddText is not exists in the file, mark it as new HighScore. If name exists, but the new one is greater, we will mark the new one as a HighScore ,and filter the exists one out. While reading the file, if the name doesn't match with the toAddText name, will be automatically appended to the temporary ArrayList tmpLines. Finally, If the toAddText is a new HighScore, add it to the file
      Parameters:
      toAddText - A Sting[] of length 3 that contains player's name, level, and, exp respectively

    • updateSortCSV

      public static void updateSortCSV​(SortedSet<PlayerStat> stats)
      A public static method to update the csv file to become the correct sorted order. By Getting the SortedSet stats, and overwrite the file with all the data obtained from each element of stats. [ Note: use the GETTER to obtained all the PlayerStat object's field.] then write the text to the .csv file in the correct format of "Name,1,0"
      Parameters:
      stats -
